channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Elon Musk’s wealth just crossed $400 billion — now he can say he’s Rockefeller rich
item.description: Musk’s wealth pile represents a 1.5% chunk of U.S. gross domestic product, putting him on par with John D. Rockefeller.

item.title: Your home insurance costs more in high-risk areas. Your mortgage should, too.
item.description: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac don’t factor climate change into rates. More frequent floods, hurricanes and wildfires raise systemic default risk.

item.title: Europe's Gas Prices Drop on Milder Weather Forecasts
item.description: Europe’s natural-gas prices dropped after forecasts of milder temperatures, however ANZ said market balance remains delicate, with the expiration of t...

item.title: Stock Futures Slip While Swiss Franc Weakens After Big Rate Cut
item.description: U.S. stock futures fell while global stocks were largely higher.

item.title: Safety, Liquidity Add to U.S. Dollar's Appeal
item.description: The dollar fell against a basket of currencies but ING continues to favor the greenback given its safe-haven status and higher yield, adding it is wel...

item.title: Investors Shouldn't Count on Much Help From the Fed Next Year
item.description: Markets still expect two or three rate cuts in 2025. That could be too optimistic.

item.title: These 10 most-loved S&P 500 stocks could see as much as 50% upside in 2025
item.description: Some of the highest-rated stocks are plays on rapid sales growth, but there are also value-oriented names on the list.

item.title: ‘My strategy may be flawed’: Will I lose out on $500,000 SIPC insurance coverage if I only have one investment account?
item.description: “As a retiree, I set up multiple accounts at the same firm.”

item.title: Oil Broadly Flat Amid Demand Weakness, New Sanctions Against Russia
item.description: Oil prices were broadly stable as bearish demand trends offset support from tougher sanctions against Russia, with EU ambassadors agreeing on a new pa...

item.title: 100% stocks for retirement? A new study says dump the 60/40 portfolio and target-date funds.
item.description: An all-equity portfolio, with a focus on international stocks, could be the key to maximizing retirement wealth, research suggests.
